info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 5 at 5:58PM PDT until September 5 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Elko NV
info.description:
Slow moving thunderstorms are producing excessive rainfall over the mountains, draining into nearby roadways, causing some of the roads to be flooded or covered in mud.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of central and north central Nevada, including the following counties, in central Nevada, Nye. In north central Nevada, Lander.
* WHEN...Until 900 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 558 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Manhattan, Round Mountain, Tonopah, Hadley, Carvers, Arc Dome, Mount Jefferson, Reese River Valley and Tonopah Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING
